explanation: The report is correct. Given the supplied macro definition (#define LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0)), the assignment int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg); always yields 0, so the controlling expression if (err) is a constant false (invariant). This is not one of the permitted exceptions to MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 (it is not an intended infinite loop nor the permitted do-while constant-false case), so the code as shown violates Rule 14.3. (In practice the macro is likely a no-op for some build configurations and may be non-constant in others; MISRA checking is per the effective translation unit, so with the shown definition the violation stands.)
